com.bittercreektech.xmlmc.types

Class Call

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bittercreektech.xmlmc.types.Call
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SwType

    public class Call
extends java.lang.Object
implements SwType
    A class representing a supportworks call. Once one considers the possibility for additional call values The possibilities of options to create a call become nearly innumerable. This Class abstracts most of that configuration into setters and ensures that every call has the minimum required parameters for the method it is being used with.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Call.Status
      An enumeration of call statuses and their respective numerical values For use in the status setter.

            java.lang.String callClass)
     throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        Instantiate the call
        Parameters:
        xmlmc - The XmlMethodCall object that you are currently using. Required for database queries that are performed automatically.
        callClass - The class of the call you wish to log
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException

      • buildXml

        public ComplexParam buildXml()
        The buildXml method responsible for taking all the fields and parsing them into a ComplexParam in the correct order
        Specified by:
        buildXml in interface SwType
        Returns:
        An xml object whose string representation may look like this 
        
         <params>
             <callClass>Incident</callClass>
             <slaName>P1</slaName>
             ...other options
         </params>

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(java.lang.String priority)
        If you know the priority ID of the call you can specify it directly. Otherwise we will attempt to use sql queries to infer what the priority should be.

      • setSummary

        public void setSummary(java.lang.String summary)
        Provide a short description of the call. If this value is set and description is not set, description will be populated with the value from summary.
        Parameters:
        summary - Short description of the call

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Provide a long description of the problem.
        Parameters:
        description - problem text

      • setCostCenter

        public void setCostCenter(java.lang.String costCenter)
        If you know what the cost center should be you can specify it directly. Otherwise we will attempt to infer this information from the customer selection if it is available. In this case, only set the customer, do not use this method.
        Parameters:
        costCenter - Cost center for the call

      • setProbCode

        public void setProbCode(java.lang.String probCode)
        Add a problem profile to the call
        Parameters:
        probCode - Problem Profile Short Code

      • setSite

        public void setSite(java.lang.String site)
        If you know what the site should be, you can specify it directly. Otherwise we will attempt to infer this information from the customer selection if it is available. In this case, only set the customer do not use this method.
        Parameters:
        site - Site for the call

      • setCondition

        public void setCondition(int condition)
        Set the call condition
        Parameters:
        condition - Numerical representation of the condition to set

      • setTimeSpent

        public void setTimeSpent(int timeSpent)
        Set the amount of time spent in minutes, on this call. If this is not set, the default is 5 minutes.
        Parameters:
        timeSpent - Amount of time spent on the call in minutes.

      • setUpdateCode

        public void setUpdateCode(java.lang.String updateCode)
        Set a custom update code for the first diary entry. If this is not set the default is API
        Parameters:
        updateCode -

      • setUpdateSource

        public void setUpdateSource(java.lang.String updateSource)
        Provide a custom update source for the first diary entry. If this is not set the default is Xmlmc API
        Parameters:
        updateSource -

      • setFileAttachment

        public void setFileAttachment(java.lang.String fileName)
        Attach a file when logging the call.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the complete path to a file you wish to attach. Java must be able to access this path.

      • setImpactAndUrgency

        public void setImpactAndUrgency(java.lang.String sla,
                                java.lang.String impact,
                                java.lang.String urgency)
        Use this method if you would like the priority to be auotmatically calculated based on impact and urgency.
        Parameters:
        sla - The SLA to use when making calculations
        impact - The impact of the call
        urgency - The urgency of the call

      • assignTo

        public void assignTo(java.lang.String group)
        This method is used by the Helpdesk API when assigning calls to groups. It does not need to be called manually, and may result in an error if not used appropriately.
        Parameters:
        group - group to assign the call to.
        See Also:
        Helpdesk.logAndAssignNewCall(Call, String), assignTo(String, String)

      • setLogDate

        public void setLogDate(java.lang.String logDate)
        Set the logDate of the call. This is required and set automatically when logging a deferred call, otherwise It defaults to the current date and time.
        Parameters:
        logDate - The date and time to log the call in the format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss see: W3Schools for more details

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(Call.Status status)
        Set the status of the call. Useful mostly when performing updates, defaults to pending
        Parameters:
        status - status to set the call to
        See Also:
        Call.Status

      • assignTo

        public void assignTo(java.lang.String group,
                     java.lang.String analyst)
        Analyst to assign the call to. Is used by the Helpdesk API when logging and assigning calls And could cause errors when called manually.
        Parameters:
        group - Group to assign the call to
        analyst - Analyst to assign the call to
        See Also:
        Helpdesk.logAndAssignNewCall(Call, String, String), assignTo(String)
